availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard Taylor Jacob (KY Lt Gov./Ninth Kentucky Cavalry)

body.p: Lieutenant Governor of Kentucky from 1863 to 1864. Son of John Jeremiah Jacob and Lucy Donald Robertson Jacob. Married to Sarah Benton Jacob, daughter of Thomas Hart Benton of Missouri, on January 17, 1848. Father of Richard T Jacob and Sarah Jacob. Married to Laura Wilson Jacob on June 15, 1865. Father of John Jacob, William Jacob, Donald Jacob, Brent Jacob, and Laura Jacob. Captain in Mexican American War from 1846 to 1848 under John C. Fremont. Elected to the Kentucky House of Representatives as a Democrat in 1859. Elector for John C. Breckenridge, representing the Southern Democratic Party, from 1860-62. Lieutenant Governor in Kentucky from 1863 to 1864.

ab.bibl: John E. Kleber, “Richard Taylor Jacob,” The Encyclopedia of Louisville, (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2000), pg. 430.
